definition: to plan to/to draft (a plan)/to imitate/to assess/to compare/pseudo-
doubtful/suspicious/variant of 擬|拟[ni3]/to emulate/to imitate
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: The technological specification of the pole by the high speed warm extrusion was worked out.
sentences.chinese: 拟制了磁极高速温挤压工艺规范。

sentences.english: Since becoming prime minister last year, he has sketched out a consistent worldview.
sentences.chinese: 自从去年当选首相，他已拟制了始终如一的世界观。

sentences.english: Transfer of property right included in B/L should be recognized as a new method of delivery:draft system delivery.
sentences.chinese: 提单物权移转应当是一种新的交付方式一拟制交付。

sentences.english: The design of activities and the drafting in the planning book.
sentences.chinese: 活动的设计与各种计画书的拟制。

sentences.english: Hard-coded values don't facilitate flexibility, they inhibit it.
sentences.chinese: 硬编码的值不仅没有提高灵活性，反而拟制了灵活性。

definition: first draft/to draw up (a first version)
to make a draft/to draw up (plans)
to infer/to consider and come to a judgment/to recommend/to estimate/deduced to be
